column2: The liche has discarded their life to achieve an existance as an immortal undead. As long as their will remains unbroken, they are almost impossible to destroy permanently.
The fragile bones are protected by legion armour.
Built in the style of the Tomb Kings, only the highest officers of the Dread Legion will take to the battlefield on top of this chariot.
Giant leonine statues, almost impervious to harm; they wade through foes, crushing them like bothersome insects.
Not all kings of Nehekara stand against Nagash. Some have been seduced by the power Nagash offers his loyal subjects.
Necromancers follow in the footsteps of Nagash, but none ever reached his mastery. For many, this pursuit ends in the service of Nagash and for the most talented few, in lichedom.
Through his disciples, Nagash increases his influence on the world of the living. And where Nagash has influence, the dead will not find any rest.
In life he marched ahead as one of the generals of the Dread Legion and even in death the soldiers heed his commands.
Countless Legions lay beneath the sands, waiting for Nagash or his servants to call them back to battle the living.
